overview_of_class:
This course is designed to provide an overview of core mathematical concepts that permeate business, science and everyday life. The primary focus is on mathematical tools needed in a variety of degree programs. Topics include: functions and graphs, linear, polynomial and rational equations, inequalities and their applications, modeling, variation, and systems of equations. The course does not count for credit if taken after any higher mathematics course.

This course is conducted completely online. A technology fee will be added to tuition.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Students will be able to use algebraic techniques to solve a variety of mathematical problems.
Students will be to use critical thinking and mathematical concepts to model real world problems.
Students will be use critical thinking to solve problems.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Readings

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Online homework, handwritten or typed homework with detailed feedback, midterm exam (proctored remotely), final exam (proctored remotely).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Required: NEW MyMathLab with Pearson eText - Instant Access- for College Algebra, 5th Edition by Beecher, Penna & Bittinger ISBN-13: 9780321981783 (Online purchase price: $103.95).

Or: College Algebra, Books a la Carte Edition plus MyMathLab with Pearson eText, Access Card Package, 5th Edition by Beecher, Penna & Bittinger (Include Unbound (saleable) Text with Access Card) ISBN-13: 9780321973443 (Suggested retail price: $180.67).

(A Hard copy of the textbook is not required since the access to MyMathLab includes access to an eText version of the book. If buying a hard copy of the book, it is typically to purchase a bundle that includes access to the required MyMathLab homework system.)
